summary: Parkinson's-friendly Account tab: no truncation in Comfort mode, Trade column never cut off, fewer columns by default, and tremor-safe confirm debounce.

features.title: Positions Table: No Ellipses in Comfort Mode
features.summary: In Comfort mode the positions table shows full text and scrolls horizontally instead of truncating with "...".
features.description:
For users with Comfort Mode on, the Account tab positions table no longer truncates column headers or data with ellipses.

**Smart defaults:** Positions default to 4 columns (Symbol, Pos, P&L, Trade) so each column gets more space. A hint under the column chooser explains: "Fewer columns by default so each stays readable. Use the chooser above to add more."

**Scroll instead of clip:** The table has a minimum width in Comfort mode; if the card is narrower, the table scrolls horizontally so you can see all content. Cell text uses overflow-visible in Comfort so nothing is cut off.

**Trade column always visible:** The Trade column (Trade + Risk Manager buttons) has a fixed minimum width (7.5rem) so the buttons are never cut off, in any mode.

features.title: Tremor-Safe Confirm Buttons
features.summary: Order confirm and cancel-order buttons ignore accidental double-taps within 500ms.
features.description:
Critical action buttons ("Send order" and "Yes, cancel order") now use a 500ms cooldown so a tremor-induced double-tap only fires once. The first click runs immediately; repeated clicks within 500ms are ignored.

Implemented via a reusable hook, useDebouncedCriticalClick, so future confirm dialogs can use the same pattern. Aligns with PD UI research recommending 300â€“500ms debounce on order-entry buttons.

features.title: Comfort Mode: Touch and Motion
features.summary: Comfort mode adds touch-action to remove tap delay and shortens transitions on interactive elements.
features.description:
Two small improvements when Comfort Mode is on:

**Touch:** Buttons and tabs use touch-action: manipulation so touch devices don't add a 300ms tap delay. Helps users who use a tablet or touchscreen.

**Motion:** When the OS has not set "Reduce motion," Comfort mode still shortens transitions on buttons, tabs, checkboxes, and menu items to 0.08s. Reduces motion sensitivity without requiring the system preference.
